consumer.translation[0].definitions[0].d: someone who buys and uses products and services
consumer.translation[0].definitions[0].e: Consumers will soon be paying higher airfares.
It will offer a wider choice of goods for the consumer (=consumers in general).
Consumer demand led to higher imports of manufactured goods.
Consumer spending was down by 0.1% last month.
consumer.translation[0].note_box[0].sect: Our demand for consumer goods increases all the time.
Consumer demand decreased as a result of the recession.
Higher taxes will reduce consumer spending.
There have been complaints from consumer groups about the high prices charged by some companies.
Competition between businesses leads to more consumer choice.
Our advertising is aimed at teenagers because they are our main consumer market.
In the west, we live in a consumer society.
Ownership of consumer durables is a reflection of standards of living.
the consumer boom of the 1980s in Britain
The US is the world’s biggest oil consumer.
The average consumer has become more price conscious.
Demand from domestic consumers is increasing.
consumer.translation[1].definitions[0].d: a person who buys goods, products, and services for their own use, not for business use or to resell
consumer.translation[1].definitions[0].e: Demand for autos is increasing as consumers feel more confident about the economy.
Oil price rises will be passed on to the consumer (=consumers in general) in higher costs.
consumer.translation[1].definitions[1].d: a person, organization, industry, or country that uses products, services, energy, or natural materials
consumer.translation[1].definitions[1].e: South Africa is one the world’s major coal producers and a significant coal consumer.
